_header: O Lord of whom I do depend
Note:
The first line opens a prayer in Edinburgh, National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 1.1.6 [Bannatyne MS], f. 41, printed Ritchie (1928)
XRitchie, W. Tod. The Bannatyne Manuscript. 4 parts in 4 vols. Scottish Text Society 3rd ser. 5 (1928); n.s. 22 (1928); n.s. 23 (1930); n.s. 26 (1934) Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1928-34; ed. by Ritchie et al, 2.104-5.

CULIi639.Transcription:
O lord of whome I doe dependbehold my carful hartfor when thy
                    will & pleasur isis [sic] relese me of my smart
